Commenting on these changes, Eric Schmidt said in the press release: We've been talking about how best to simplify our management structure and speed up decision making for a long time. By clarifying our individual roles we'll create clearer responsibility and accountability at the top of the company. In my clear opinion, Larry Page is ready to lead and I'm excited about working with both him and Sergey Brin for a long time to come. ' online privacy. When Larry Page and Co-founder Sergey Brin started Google, they envisioned a company that was more socially conscious and responsive than most corporations. That outlook was famously expressed by Google's unofficial motto, Don't be evil. Over the past decade, under Eric Schmidt 's leadership, the company has all too often paid only lip service to the sentiment, Consumer Watchdog said.
